Laudanum, for what ails you.title: A Wandering Galaxy
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
Part of the enjoyment I get from producing my music is creating covers to go with my releases. I will photograph anything and then set about designing a cover.
My wife challenged me on this particular occasion, to create an album cover from her left over dinner. Who knew that the remains of a pasta dish could turn into a galaxy!!

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: all memories fade in time, some just slower than others
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
"all memories fade in time" marks a double celebration for me.
Not only is it my 200th Bandcamp release, but 30th May is also the 4th anniversary since I first pressed "publish album" and started sharing my music on an unsuspecting world.
I have enjoyed every minute of the journey so far, and long may it continue. Here's to the next four years and beyond!
I would like to thank everyone who has supported me by listening to, buying and downloading my music over the past few years. I hope you continue to join me on this voyage and see where we end up.
As always, I would recommend listening to my music with headphones at a low to medium volume and just let your mind wander.
All the best
Ben
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Tracks recorded and mixed May 2024
Cover artwork © B.Beadle original photograph taken Yosemite National Park, California USA February 2014

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Always By Your Side
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
"Life is made up of meetings and partings.
That is the way of it.
I am sure we shall never forget
Boris...
or this first parting
that there was among us."
(A Christmas Carol - Charles Dickens - edited)
In memory of our lovely boy Boris who passed away yesterday after a brief illness. Thank you for the short time you were in our lives. You made us so happy and you touched the lives of all you met.
We will never forget you xxx
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: City of a Thousand Suns
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
"City of a Thousand Suns" marks my 175th release on Bandcamp.
I worked on these tracks earlier in the year and then I got sidetracked by a few months of ill health. I wanted to end the year knowing that this album was finally finished and ready for release. I hope you enjoy listening to it.
Wishing you all health and happiness for the coming New Year.

All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Recorded March 2021
Cover photograph © B.Beadle Taken Priestfields, Rochester, Kent February 2021
These four albums (Fever Dreams I-IV) are being released today to mark my first anniversary of making music. It was a year ago today that I unpacked my Akai APC Key 25 and started messing around with sound.
I would recommend listening to them with headphones at a low to medium volume.
I hope you enjoy listening to them.

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: in the realm of the ocean forests
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
I had lots of tracks that needed tidying up and finishing off and when I counted them up at the end of November, there were 23 releases ready to go. It then dawned on me, with one more release, I would be able to create my own musical Advent calendar.
"in the realm of the ocean forests " brings to a close my celebration of Advent. I hope you have enjoyed listening to all of the music I have released this month.
I would like to thank all of my followers both old and new. I really do appreciate your continuing support and the fact that you take time out of your busy lives to listen to the music I make.
I still enjoy making music and I have no plans to stop anytime soon. I plan to take a little rest over the festive break, and I will be back in 2025.
For now, I would like to wish you all a Merry Christmas and all the best for the coming New Year.
Best wishes
Ben (aka Laudanum, for what ails you)
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Nights In The City
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
"Nights In The City" marks my 100th release on Bandcamp.
I wanted to make something more 'lively' to celebrate the occasion and these tracks are a mixed bag of sounds and styles, which I believe, meet the brief!
On the whole, this is a positive and upbeat album which reminds me of the many great nights I've had in cities (also towns, villages and hamlets) around the world. When I remember those nights, I often picture them as scenes from a movie and now I have soundtracks for them.
I did most of my growing up in the 80s and 90s and these tracks owe a huge debt to the music, film and TV of those times. 'Questing Nights' would not sound out of place in an 80s, low-budget sword and sorcery flick, which truth be told, I would probably still watch now!
Today is officially the start of British Summer Time. I hope these tracks accompany you through the coming summer on those long, hot and sometimes sticky "Nights In The City."
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Recorded January 2022 tinkered with February/March 2022
Cover photograph © B.Beadle taken Willis Tower, Chicago, Illinois, USA September 2018
For Mary, the best "human" mum in the world and for Katie, the best "dog" mum in the world - Happy Mother's Day xxx
I would recommend listening to the album with headphones at a medium volume.

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Seen Better Days
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
I recorded these tracks on an unseasonably cold day back in the summer. It really felt like winter had arrived.
I don't know if it was the cold that influenced the sound of these tracks but they all have a touch of melancholy about them. It just didn't seem right releasing them during the carefree days of summer, so I've waited until now.

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Submerged
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Tracks 1-4 recorded May 2021
Tracks 5-6 recorded June 2020 tinkered with May 2021
Cover photograph © B.Beadle Taken Riverside Country Park, Rainham, Kent August 2020
It was a year ago today that I released my first album on Bandcamp, actually it was my first ever album released anywhere!
I had no idea that a year later I would still be making music, let alone be in a position to mark the anniversary with 'Submerged' my 30th release.
This past year and a bit has been tough on everyone's mental health, and I hope you've all managed to find a place where you can escape for a while.
My place, is creating this music. It's taken me nearly 45 years to find a creative outlet which I enjoy doing, and which gives me so much pleasure. As I have a lot of lost time to make up for, I don't intend to stop anytime soon!
I would like to thank everyone who has supported me by listening to, buying and downloading my music over the past year. I need to give a special mention to my wife, Katie, as she hasn't minded me sneaking off to my studio, on numerous occasions, when I really should have been doing something else.
Here's to many more years of messing around with sound!!
Cheers
Laudanum, for what ails you (aka Ben)

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Towering Spires Of Awe
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
I have been lucky enough to visit Bryce Canyon National Park three times, and on each occasion it has taken my breath away. Being surrounded by hoodoos, spires and colourful rock formations gives it a sense of being otherworldly, almost dreamlike.
These tracks are inspired by those visits and named after some of the famous features within the park.
I hope you enjoy listening to them and as always, I would recommend wearing headphones and listening to them at a low to medium volume.
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Recorded July/August 2021
Cover photograph © B.Beadle Taken Bryce Canyon National Park, Utah, USA September 2019

Laudanum, for what ails you.title: Watching Westerns With My Dad
Laudanum, for what ails you.about:
My Dad was a huge fan of the western genre and I watched countless westerns with him, whilst growing up. We watched bad ones, mediocre ones and some down right fantastic ones.
This piece of music stirred something in my memories and now when I listen to it, I imagine the unending chases and the stark and beautiful landscapes rolling by.
There is also a sense of unease in the music that fits with the sudden outbursts of violence contained in many westerns, and the fear of what awaits the protagonist on their journey.
Most of all though, it reminds me of happier times. Sat with my Dad, watching westerns and loving every minute of it.
Happy 83rd birthday Dad. It would be so much nicer to be able to say that to you in person, but I'm sure you are listening somewhere.
We miss you xxx
All compositions Laudanum, for what ails you
Recorded and mixed July 2022
Cover artwork © B.Beadle original photograph taken Scenic Route 12, Utah, USA September 2019
